alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 31 at 10:17PM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .Another winter storm is expected to impact the region early next week. Precipitation should start to move in late Monday afternoon through the evening and continue through Tuesday. Initially this precipitation should be a wintry mix with the potential to produce of ice accumulations of one to three tenths of an inch. Some accumulating snow should occur Tuesday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Ice accumulations of one to three tenths possible followed by snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Portions of north central Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely should these ice accumulations develop. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening and morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There remains the potential for this storm to shift north or south. Travelers are urged to keep up to date with the latest forecasts and statements concerning this potentially hazardous travel situation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
